item.title: CDK with SSO
item.description: Problem CDK usually authorizes with default profile of the AWS CLI (on Linux systems you’ll find it in the file ~/.aws/config). If you’d like to use another profile you’re able to pass it with the --profile <yourProfile> parameter. However, if you pass an SSO profile you’ll get an error like this: Need to perform AWS calls for account <AWSAccountID>, but no credentials have been configured On the corresponding github issue there are several solutions mentioned.

item.title: put a file on multiple S3 buckets asynchronous
item.description: Today I was trying hard to write a Lambda function, that deploys a file on multiple S3 buckets asynchronous. My problem was that the files were only uploaded every other time I ran the Lambda. Of course, this behavior suggests, that there was something wrong the Promises and/or the async/await combinations. Unfortunately, I still don’t understand the Promises completely. I once have to dive into it. Finally, my script works. But it is unsatisfactory not understanding completely what’s going on.

item.title: CDK CodePipeline
item.description: It took me almost a day to figure out how to fix a problem with deploying a pipeline with CDK.
